title: Embroided Panels Two Embroidered Panels

  materials_name: silk (textile) metal thread

  techniques_name: sewing (needleworking technique) embroidering

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: These are two panels of cloth embroided with metal thread. The top panel is cream coloured
 with tapering towards the end. The bottom panel is red
 pleated on one side
 and with three metal rings attached on the other.

  subject_terms_1: belts (costume accessories) Peranakan embroidery (visual works)

  subject_terms_2: Embroidery Peranakan (Asian people) Belts (Clothing)

  subject_terms_3: Peranakan costumes

  sgcool_label_text: Both pieces of cloth are embroidered with metal thread and lined on the underside. The cream coloured panel tapers towards one end. The red panel is pleated on one side and has 3 metal rings attached on the other. They could have been used as belts. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.

metadata.physical_appearance: These are two panels of cloth embroided with metal thread. The top panel is cream coloured, with tapering towards the end. The bottom panel is red, pleated on one side, and with three metal rings attached on the other.
